summary: The Access to Breast Cancer Diagnosis Act of 2025 aims to amend the Public Health Service Act to ensure group health plans and insurance issuers cover diagnostic and supplemental breast examinations without cost-sharing requirements. It defines these examinations, addresses grandfathered health plans, addresses high deductible health plans, and sets an effective date of January 1, 2026. The bill prioritizes access to necessary screenings and tests, irrespective of cost to the patient.
